Flub.Name: Bombing
Flub.Description: T

Flub.Name: Distribution
Flub.Description: The method of distribution

Flub.Name: Random
Flub.Description: A randomized distribution that results in pure chaotic patterns.

Flub.Name: Poisson
Flub.Description: A discrete probability distribution function that results in a natural distribution.

Flub.Name: Grid
Flub.Description: A normalized grid distribution function that results in a systematic pattern.

Flub.Name: Clusters
Flub.Description: The number of independent distribution clusters.

Flub.Name: Density
Flub.Description: The density of the independent clusters, and the instances within each cluster.

Flub.Name: Variations
Flub.Description: The number of variations to create. These variations will then be randomly repeated on the surface. Higher numbers take longer to process but creates more varied results.

Flub.Name: Jitter
Flub.Description: The random offset applied to each instance while distributing.

Flub.Name: Blend Mode
Flub.Description: How the base terrain and bombed instances are merged.

Flub.Name: Add
Flub.Description: Adds the two values together.

Flub.Name: Screen
Flub.Description: Adds the two inputs without overexposing the output.

Flub.Name: Max
Flub.Description: Selects the higher of the two.

Flub.Name: Difference
Flub.Description: Creates the difference of the two inputs.

Flub.Name: Variations
Flub.Description: T

Flub.Name: Strength
Flub.Description: The minimum contribution level in overlapping instances.

Flub.Name: Strength Max
Flub.Description: The maximum contribution level in overlapping instances.

Flub.Name: Proportional
Flub.Description: Enforce proportional scaling, or allow non-proportional modifications.

Flub.Name: Minimum Scale
Flub.Description: The smallest randomized instance size.

Flub.Name: Maximum Scale
Flub.Description: The largest randomized instance size.

Flub.Name: Minimum Rotation
Flub.Description: The minimum randomized rotation angle.

Flub.Name: Maximum Rotation
Flub.Description: The maximum randomized rotation angle.

Flub.Name: Seed
Flub.Description: The randomization pattern or seed for the node's process.
